presenter.name: Jun Ho Choi

presenter.bio: Long Term Outcomes after EUS-guided Pancreatic Cyst Ablation

slide.title: Long Term Outcomes after EUS-guided Pancreatic Cyst Ablation
slide.titleNormalized: long term outcomes after eus-guided pancreatic cyst ablation
slide.text:
Long Term Outcomes after EUS-guided Pancreatic Cyst Ablation
Jun Ho Choi Department of Gastroenterology, Dankook University College of Medicine, Cheonan, Korea

slide.title: Contents
slide.text: Brief overview Efficacy of EUS-guided ethanol ablation Safety of EUS-guided ethanol ablation Long-term durability of cyst resolution Conclusion

slide.title: D/Dx: MCN, IPMN or SCN ?
slide.notes:
Let me show you one case At head of pancreas, about 2.7cm sized oligolocular cystic lesion was seen on EUS
* * Indication : pancreas cystic lesion
Premedications(iv): midazolam 3 mg iv, none Complications: no immediate complication
* Examination was done with UE-260 radial EUS. * Examination was done with UM-3R miniprobe.
* EUS findings : Pancreas의 echo는 정상이며 pancreatitis를 시사할 만한 소견 관찰되지 않음. Main p-duct은 0.18cm 으로 늘어나 있지 않음. Pancreas head-neck portion에 2.7 x 2.7 cm sized cystic lesion 관찰됨. Septum이 있으며, wall은 얇음. oligolocular cyst이며, mural nodule은 관찰되지 않음. Contrast enhance 시에 early phase에서 septum과 wall이 약간 enhance 되는 양상이었고, delayed phase 까지 지속됨. P-duct와 cyst간의 communication은 관찰되지 않아, IPMN 가능성은 떨어질 것으로 생각됨.
Stomach MB PW에 보이는 SMT-like lesion은 pancreas cystic lesion에 의해 extrinsic compression인 것으로 확인됨.
Imp) 1. SCN > MCN 2. IPMN, unlikely 3. Stomach MB PW, extrinsic compression by pancreatic cystic lesion
slide.notesNormalized:
let me show you one case at head of pancreas, about 2.7cm sized oligolocular cystic lesion was seen on eus
* * indication : pancreas cystic lesion
premedications(iv): midazolam 3 mg iv, none complications: no immediate complication

* eus findings : pancreas의 echo는 정상이며 pancreatitis를 시사할 만한 소견 관찰되지 않음. main p-duct은 0.18cm 으로 늘어나 있지 않음. pancreas head-neck portion에 2.7 x 2.7 cm sized cystic lesion 관찰됨. septum이 있으며, wall은 얇음. oligolocular cyst이며, mural nodule은 관찰되지 않음. contrast enhance 시에 early phase에서 septum과 wall이 약간 enhance 되는 양상이었고, delayed phase 까지 지속됨. p-duct와 cyst간의 communication은 관찰되지 않아, ipmn 가능성은 떨어질 것으로 생각됨.
stomach mb pw에 보이는 smt-like lesion은 pancreas cystic lesion에 의해 extrinsic compression인 것으로 확인됨.
imp) 1. scn > mcn 2. ipmn, unlikely 3. stomach mb pw, extrinsic compression by pancreatic cystic lesion
slide.notesHtml:
Let me show you one case

At head of pancreas, about 2.7cm sized oligolocular cystic lesion was seen on EUS

*

* Indication

: pancreas cystic lesion

Premedications(iv): midazolam 3 mg iv, none

Complications: no immediate complication

* Examination was done with UE-260 radial EUS.

* Examination was done with UM-3R miniprobe.

* EUS findings

: Pancreas의 echo는 정상이며 pancreatitis를 시사할 만한 소견 관찰되지 않음.

Main p-duct은 0.18cm 으로 늘어나 있지 않음.

Pancreas head-neck portion에 2.7 x 2.7 cm sized cystic lesion 관찰됨.

Septum이 있으며, wall은 얇음. oligolocular cyst이며, mural nodule은

관찰되지 않음.

Contrast enhance 시에 early phase에서 septum과 wall이 약간 enhance 되는

양상이었고, delayed phase 까지 지속됨.

P-duct와 cyst간의 communication은 관찰되지 않아, IPMN 가능성은 떨어질

것으로 생각됨.

Stomach MB PW에 보이는 SMT-like lesion은 pancreas cystic lesion에 의해

extrinsic compression인 것으로 확인됨.

Imp) 1. SCN > MCN

2. IPMN, unlikely

3. Stomach MB PW, extrinsic compression by pancreatic cystic lesion

slide.title: Current Management
slide.notes: This is current management of pancreatic cystic tumor. When the lesion is mucinous or malignant, generally surgical resection is recommended. When the lesion is serous one, just follow-up seems to be enough. When it is pseudocyst, we need to drain it.
slide.notesNormalized: this is current management of pancreatic cystic tumor. when the lesion is mucinous or malignant, generally surgical resection is recommended. when the lesion is serous one, just follow-up seems to be enough. when it is pseudocyst, we need to drain it.
slide.notesHtml:
This is current management of pancreatic cystic tumor.

When the lesion is mucinous or malignant, generally surgical resection is recommended.

When the lesion is serous one, just follow-up seems to be enough.

When it is pseudocyst, we need to drain it.
slide.text: Ho KY, Brugge WR. Gastrointest Endosc 2009;69:S22 Current Management

slide.title: High risk stigmata
slide.notes: All cyst with high risk stigmata , should be considered surgery All cyst with worrisome features should be evaluated by EUS to further risk stratify All patients without worrisome features should undergo surveilance
slide.notesNormalized: all cyst with high risk stigmata , should be considered surgery all cyst with worrisome features should be evaluated by eus to further risk stratify all patients without worrisome features should undergo surveilance
slide.notesHtml:
All cyst with high risk stigmata , should be considered surgery

All cyst with worrisome features should be evaluated by EUS to further risk stratify

All patients without worrisome features should undergo surveilance
slide.text: High risk stigmata: obstructive jaundice enhancing solid component MPD > 10mm Worrisome features: cyst size > 3cm thickened cyst wall MPD: 5~9mm non-enhancing mural nodule abrupt MPD caliber change

slide.title: Histology of resected cystic tumors
slide.notes:
One study from USA reported their resection cases. the most common cystic lesion resected was a serous cystadenoma. 56% of the patients with pancreatic cyst underwent unnecessary surgery.
Malignant diagnoses were present in 18% of patients.
slide.notesNormalized:
one study from usa reported their resection cases. the most common cystic lesion resected was a serous cystadenoma. 56% of the patients with pancreatic cyst underwent unnecessary surgery.
malignant diagnoses were present in 18% of patients.
slide.notesHtml:
One study from USA reported their resection cases.

the most common cystic lesion resected was a serous cystadenoma.

56% of the patients with pancreatic cyst underwent unnecessary surgery.

Malignant diagnoses were present in 18% of patients.
slide.text: Histology of resected cystic tumors Total 170 Serous cystadenoma 72 42% IPMN (benign) 25 15% Mucinous cystadenoma 16 9% Pseudocyst 9 5% Other benign cysts 16 9% Invasive IPMN 12 7% Invasive MCN 6 4% Neuroendocrine tumor 6 4% Solid pseudopapillary tumor 4 3% ( Allen PJ et al, Ann Surg 2006)

slide.title: Substantial Morbidity of Surgical Resection
slide.notes: Although surgery is only curative treatment, but it is associated with substantial morbidity and mortality
slide.notesNormalized: although surgery is only curative treatment, but it is associated with substantial morbidity and mortality
slide.notesHtml: Although surgery is only curative treatment, but it is associated with substantial morbidity and mortality
slide.text: Substantial Morbidity of Surgical Resection Pancreatic resection Only curative treatment Morbidity; 20-40% Mortality; 2% Management strategy needs to be individualized, applying a risk-benefit analysis Allen PJ et al, Ann Surg 2006 Goh BK et al. Am J Surg 2006

slide.title: Local treatment modality for pancreatic cystic tumor
slide.titleNormalized: local treatment modality for pancreatic cystic tumor
slide.notes: EUS-guided ethanol lavage is a local treatment modality for pancreatic cystic tumors.
slide.notesNormalized: eus-guided ethanol lavage is a local treatment modality for pancreatic cystic tumors.
slide.notesHtml: EUS-guided ethanol lavage is a local treatment modality for pancreatic cystic tumors.
slide.text: Local treatment modality for pancreatic cystic tumor EUS-guided ethanol lavage + paclitaxel injection

slide.title: EUS-guided ethanol lavage
slide.notes:
Havard group reported the first pilot study of EUS guided ethanol lavage of pancreatic cystic lesions. 25 patients were enrolled. They escalated dose of ethanol upto 80%. However, the complete resolution of cyst was observed only one-third of patients. For the treatment of cystic tumors, more effective and still non-invasive modality is required.
So we combined taxol injection after EUS-guided ethanol lavage.
slide.notesNormalized:
havard group reported the first pilot study of eus guided ethanol lavage of pancreatic cystic lesions. 25 patients were enrolled. they escalated dose of ethanol upto 80%. however, the complete resolution of cyst was observed only one-third of patients. for the treatment of cystic tumors, more effective and still non-invasive modality is required.
so we combined taxol injection after eus-guided ethanol lavage.
slide.notesHtml:
Havard group reported the first pilot study of EUS guided ethanol lavage of pancreatic cystic lesions.

25 patients were enrolled.

They escalated dose of ethanol upto 80%.

However, the complete resolution of cyst was observed only one-third of patients.

For the treatment of cystic tumors, more effective and still non-invasive modality is required.

So we combined taxol injection after EUS-guided ethanol lavage.
slide.text: first report showing the safety & technical feasibility 25 patients: MCN 13, IPMN 4, SCN 3, pseudocyst 3, indeterminate 2) escalating dose of ethanol: 5~80% complete resolution of cyst: 35% EUS-guided ethanol lavage (Gan SI, et al Gastrointest Endosc 2005)

slide.title: EUS-guided ethanol lavage and paclitaxel injection
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided ethanol lavage and paclitaxel injection
slide.notes: And Pf. Seo reported the result in GIE 2008 as a new treatment for cystic tumors of the pancreas. To increase the ablative effect, in new trial, a chemotherapeutic agent (paclitaxel) has been combined with ethanol ablation therapy.
slide.notesNormalized: and pf. seo reported the result in gie 2008 as a new treatment for cystic tumors of the pancreas. to increase the ablative effect, in new trial, a chemotherapeutic agent (paclitaxel) has been combined with ethanol ablation therapy.
slide.notesHtml:
And Pf. Seo reported the result in GIE 2008 as a new treatment for cystic tumors of the pancreas.

To increase the ablative effect, in new trial, a chemotherapeutic agent (paclitaxel) has been combined with ethanol ablation therapy.
slide.text: EUS-guided ethanol lavage and paclitaxel injection

slide.title: Results
slide.notes: Among 14 included patients, 11 patients showed complete resolution. The cyst resolution rate (79%) was greater than the previously observed rate with ethanol alone, suggesting a synergistic effect between ethanol and paclitaxel. There was no significant adverse event except one case of mild pancreatitis.
slide.notesNormalized: among 14 included patients, 11 patients showed complete resolution. the cyst resolution rate (79%) was greater than the previously observed rate with ethanol alone, suggesting a synergistic effect between ethanol and paclitaxel. there was no significant adverse event except one case of mild pancreatitis.
slide.notesHtml:
Among 14 included patients, 11 patients showed complete resolution.

The cyst resolution rate (79%) was greater than the previously observed rate with ethanol alone, suggesting a synergistic effect between ethanol and paclitaxel.

There was no significant adverse event except one case of mild pancreatitis.
slide.text: Results

slide.title: Techniques of cyst ablation
slide.notes: This slide shows stepwise EUS guided pancreatic cyst ablation. FNA within a septated cyst. The cyst is lavaged using ethanol. The injected ethanol is evacuated at the end of lavage. A second ablative agent such as paclitaxel may be injected and left in the cyst cavity.
slide.notesNormalized: this slide shows stepwise eus guided pancreatic cyst ablation. fna within a septated cyst. the cyst is lavaged using ethanol. the injected ethanol is evacuated at the end of lavage. a second ablative agent such as paclitaxel may be injected and left in the cyst cavity.
slide.notesHtml: This slide shows stepwise EUS guided pancreatic cyst ablation. FNA within a septated cyst. The cyst is lavaged using ethanol. The injected ethanol is evacuated at the end of lavage. A second ablative agent such as paclitaxel may be injected and left in the cyst cavity.
slide.text: Techniques of cyst ablation Oh HC et al. GIE 2013

slide.title: EUS-guided Ablation of Pancreatic Cysts
slide.notes: To date, several clinical trials have been reported Cyst resolution rate in 33-62% Seems to be effective but Long term fu study is needed.
slide.notesNormalized: to date, several clinical trials have been reported cyst resolution rate in 33-62% seems to be effective but long term fu study is needed.
slide.notesHtml:
To date, several clinical trials have been reported Cyst resolution rate in 33-62%

Seems to be effective but

Long term fu study is needed.
slide.text: Effective? EUS-guided Ablation of Pancreatic Cysts Oh HC, Seo DW. JHBPS 2015 Complete ablation in 33-62% Lack of long-term follow-up

slide.title: EUS-guided Ablation of Pancreatic Cysts
slide.notes: Regarding the safety The safety as well as efficacy of novel treatment was the major concern The overall complication rate was about 11%. But, no cases of severe pancreatitis, bleeding, or deaths have been reported.
slide.notesNormalized: regarding the safety the safety as well as efficacy of novel treatment was the major concern the overall complication rate was about 11%. but, no cases of severe pancreatitis, bleeding, or deaths have been reported.
slide.notesHtml:
Regarding the safety

The safety as well as efficacy of novel treatment was the major concern

The overall complication rate was about 11%. But, no cases of severe pancreatitis, bleeding, or deaths have been reported.
slide.text: Safe? EUS-guided Ablation of Pancreatic Cysts Oh HC, et al. GIE 2013 Complication rate is low, and most of complications are not serious

slide.title: Distal pancreatectomy & splenectomy
slide.notes: Distal pancreatectomy was done due to persistent cyst and abscess formation. The histopathology shown that lining epithelium was completely ablated which means pseudocyst or abscess
slide.notesNormalized: distal pancreatectomy was done due to persistent cyst and abscess formation. the histopathology shown that lining epithelium was completely ablated which means pseudocyst or abscess
slide.notesHtml:
Distal pancreatectomy was done due to persistent cyst and abscess formation.

The histopathology shown that lining epithelium was completely ablated which means pseudocyst or abscess
slide.text: 150312 Distal pancreatectomy & splenectomy lining epithelium: completely ablated intrapancreatic accessory spleen pseudocyst or abscess

slide.title: F/68 5.2cm PCT head EUS-FNI #2
slide.notes:
There is case report of PVT after EUS guided ablation. Venous obliteration and thrombosis in the venous system adjacent to the cyst have been reported after EUS FNI. Extensive inflammation and pericystic leak may result in local extension of inflammation into the adjacent vessels. The initial CT scan shows about 5 cm sized located adjacen to the main portal vein at the head of pancreas
68/F
slide.notesNormalized:
there is case report of pvt after eus guided ablation. venous obliteration and thrombosis in the venous system adjacent to the cyst have been reported after eus fni. extensive inflammation and pericystic leak may result in local extension of inflammation into the adjacent vessels. the initial ct scan shows about 5 cm sized located adjacen to the main portal vein at the head of pancreas
68/f
slide.notesHtml:
There is case report of PVT after EUS guided ablation.

Venous obliteration and thrombosis in the venous system adjacent to the cyst have been reported after EUS FNI. Extensive inflammation and pericystic leak may result in local extension of inflammation into the adjacent vessels.

The initial CT scan shows about 5 cm sized located adjacen to the main portal vein at the head of pancreas

68/F
slide.text: F/68 5.2cm PCT head EUS-FNI #2

slide.notes:
FU CT after second cyst ablation shows persistent cyst with rim caclfication and portal vein thrombosis The patient underwent PPPD and portal vein thrombectomy for histologic confirmation and prevention of clinical deterioration Histopathology demonstrated that epithelial ablation was nearly complete.
When a cyst is closely located to the portal vein, the optimal injection volume of ablative agent needs to be cautiously titrated and aggressive lavage should be avoided.
slide.notesNormalized:
fu ct after second cyst ablation shows persistent cyst with rim caclfication and portal vein thrombosis the patient underwent pppd and portal vein thrombectomy for histologic confirmation and prevention of clinical deterioration histopathology demonstrated that epithelial ablation was nearly complete.
when a cyst is closely located to the portal vein, the optimal injection volume of ablative agent needs to be cautiously titrated and aggressive lavage should be avoided.
slide.notesHtml:
FU CT after second cyst ablation shows persistent cyst with rim caclfication and portal vein thrombosis

The patient underwent PPPD and portal vein thrombectomy for histologic confirmation and prevention of clinical deterioration

Histopathology demonstrated that epithelial ablation was nearly complete.

When a cyst is closely located to the portal vein, the optimal injection volume of ablative agent needs to be cautiously titrated and aggressive lavage should be avoided.

slide.title: Courtesy of Pf. Seo DW. AMC
slide.titleNormalized: courtesy of pf. seo dw. amc
slide.notes:
Here is another case. (b00ster case) About 7cm sized oligocystic lesion was noted in the tail of the pancreas. There was no mural nodule and cyst in cyst pattern was noted. The MPD showed normal caliber.
After EUS guidance, the cystic lesion in the body was punctured using 22G aspiration needle. Then cystic fluid was aspirated. It showed clear color and the amount was about 140 ml. After aspiration, 99% ethanol was injected into the cystic cavity (100 ml) and retained in the cavity for 20 minutes. Then reaspiration was done. A total 30 mg paclitaxol was injected into the cyst after 1:1 dilution with distilled water (total volume 7 ml).
The whole procedure was complited without complication.
IMPRESSION) 1. Pancreatic cystic lesion (Oligocyst, cyst in cyst pattern, no mural nodule) Mucinous cystic neoplasm, more likely 2. EUS-guided ethanol lavage was performed without complication
slide.notesNormalized:

the whole procedure was complited without complication.
impression) 1. pancreatic cystic lesion (oligocyst, cyst in cyst pattern, no mural nodule) mucinous cystic neoplasm, more likely 2. eus-guided ethanol lavage was performed without complication
slide.notesHtml:
Here is another case. (b00ster case)

About 7cm sized oligocystic lesion was noted in the tail of the pancreas.

There was no mural nodule and cyst in cyst pattern was noted.

The MPD showed normal caliber.

After EUS guidance, the cystic lesion in the body was punctured using 22G aspiration

needle. Then cystic fluid was aspirated. It showed clear color and the amount

was about 140 ml. After aspiration, 99% ethanol was injected into the cystic

cavity (100 ml) and retained in the cavity for 20 minutes. Then reaspiration was

done. A total 30 mg paclitaxol was injected into the cyst after 1:1 dilution

with distilled water (total volume 7 ml).

The whole procedure was complited without complication.

IMPRESSION) 1. Pancreatic cystic lesion

(Oligocyst, cyst in cyst pattern, no mural nodule)

Mucinous cystic neoplasm, more likely

2. EUS-guided ethanol lavage was performed without complication
slide.text: 090618 Aspirated cystic fluid: 140cc Ethanol injected: 100cc Retention time: 20 min Paclitaxel injected: 30mg Courtesy of Pf. Seo DW. AMC

slide.title: 121029 using 19G needle
slide.notes: Since the patient refused surgery, we planned 2nd booster ablation. Booster ablation was performed to induce further decrease. 28 ml of cystic fluid was aspirated and ethanol lavage was done.

slide.text: Mid-term follow-up results

slide.title: Volume Change after Treatment
slide.notes: Most of the patients showed marked size decrease during first 6 months after treatment. Some patients showed continuous size decrease until 1 year after treatment. So the treatment response can be determined more than 1 year after treatment.
slide.notesNormalized: most of the patients showed marked size decrease during first 6 months after treatment. some patients showed continuous size decrease until 1 year after treatment. so the treatment response can be determined more than 1 year after treatment.
slide.notesHtml:
Most of the patients showed marked size decrease during first 6 months after treatment.

Some patients showed continuous size decrease until 1 year after treatment.

So the treatment response can be determined more than 1 year after treatment.

slide.title: Long-term durability of cyst resolution is not well understood.
slide.titleNormalized: long-term durability of cyst resolution is not well understood.
slide.notes: The durability of cyst ablation is an important issue because cyst resolution achieved for a short-term period may not ensure the long-term ablative effect.
slide.notesNormalized: the durability of cyst ablation is an important issue because cyst resolution achieved for a short-term period may not ensure the long-term ablative effect.
slide.notesHtml: The durability of cyst ablation is an important issue because cyst resolution achieved for a short-term period may not ensure the long-term ablative effect.
slide.text: Long-term durability of cyst resolution is not well understood.

slide.title: Long-term durability of cyst resolution
slide.notes: The
slide.notesNormalized: the
slide.notesHtml: The
slide.text:
Long-term durability of cyst resolution EUS-guided Ablation Can Be a Definitive Therapy for Pancreatic Cystic Tumors
Jun Ho Choi, Dong-Wan Seo, Tae Jun Song, Do Hyun Park, Sang Soo Lee, Sung Koo Lee, Myung-Hwan Kim Department of Internal Medicine, University of Ulsan College of Medicine, Asan Medical Center Department of Internal Medicine, Dankook University College of Medicine, Dankook University Hospital Unpublished, Submitted data, AMC 2016

slide.title: Study Flowchart
slide.notes: A total of 164 patients underwent EUS-PCA. 158 patients were included for analyzing treatment response. If they had undergone successful EUS-PCA (which is defined as CR), and follow up for at least 36 months, they were included in the final analysis of long term durability
slide.notesNormalized: a total of 164 patients underwent eus-pca. 158 patients were included for analyzing treatment response. if they had undergone successful eus-pca (which is defined as cr), and follow up for at least 36 months, they were included in the final analysis of long term durability
slide.notesHtml:
A total of 164 patients underwent EUS-PCA.

158 patients were included for analyzing treatment response.

If they had undergone successful EUS-PCA (which is defined as CR), and follow up for at least 36 months, they were included in the final analysis of long term durability
slide.text: Study Flowchart

slide.title: Baseline characteristics (n=164)
slide.notes: Median age was 51 years old. Most common presumed diagnosis was MCN. Median EUS diameter was 32 mm.
slide.notesNormalized: median age was 51 years old. most common presumed diagnosis was mcn. median eus diameter was 32 mm.
slide.notesHtml: Median age was 51 years old. Most common presumed diagnosis was MCN. Median EUS diameter was 32 mm.
slide.text:
Baseline characteristics (n=164) Characteristic Patient (n=164) Age, median (range), years 51 (20─85) Sex, n (%)
Male 49 (30) Female 115 (70) Clinical presumed diagnosis, n (%)
MCN 95 (58) IPMN 22 (13) SCA 23 (14) Indeterminate 24 (15) Cyst location, n (%)

slide.title: Treatment response
slide.text:
Treatment response †12 patients, operation; 1 patient, observation. Treatment response (n=158) Dose of paclitaxel injected, mg (range) 9 (0─60) Follow-up period, mo (IQR) 69 (48─81) Treatment response
Complete resolution 114 (72.2) Partial resolution 31 (19.6) Persistent cyst 13 (8.2)† Time until complete resolution was achieved, n (%)
Early, <12mo 62 (58) Late, ≥12mo 56 (42)

slide.title: Adverse event (16/164, 9.8%)
slide.notes: This slide shows the results of prospective cohort in asan medical center. Complication s after EUS-guided cyst ablation have included pericystic leakage, pancreatitis, hemorrhage, splenic vein thrombosis. Overall complication rate was 9.8%. Pancreatitis rate was 3.6% Most complications are mild and self limited.
slide.notesNormalized: this slide shows the results of prospective cohort in asan medical center. complication s after eus-guided cyst ablation have included pericystic leakage, pancreatitis, hemorrhage, splenic vein thrombosis. overall complication rate was 9.8%. pancreatitis rate was 3.6% most complications are mild and self limited.
slide.notesHtml:
This slide shows the results of prospective cohort in asan medical center.

Overall complication rate was 9.8%. Pancreatitis rate was 3.6%

Most complications are mild and self limited.

slide.title: Treatment response
slide.notes: Patients followed for at least 3 years after complete ablation were included in the analysis of durability Kaplan Meier analysis showed that cyst remained eradicated in 98% of patients without recurrence As long as the complete cyst resolution achieved after ablation, we can expect long term durability and potential cure of pancreatic cyst.
slide.notesNormalized: patients followed for at least 3 years after complete ablation were included in the analysis of durability kaplan meier analysis showed that cyst remained eradicated in 98% of patients without recurrence as long as the complete cyst resolution achieved after ablation, we can expect long term durability and potential cure of pancreatic cyst.
slide.notesHtml:
Patients followed for at least 3 years after complete ablation were included in the analysis of durability

Kaplan Meier analysis showed that cyst remained eradicated in 98% of patients without recurrence

As long as the complete cyst resolution achieved after ablation, we can expect long term durability and potential cure of pancreatic cyst.

slide.notes:
퇴화된 locule들은 epithelial lining이 없어지고 fibrosis가 진행되면서 contracture가 나타나는 것을 확인할 수 있습니다.
Epithelial lining was denuded and replaced by secondary fibrosis
slide.notesNormalized:
퇴화된 locule들은 epithelial lining이 없어지고 fibrosis가 진행되면서 contracture가 나타나는 것을 확인할 수 있습니다.
epithelial lining was denuded and replaced by secondary fibrosis
slide.notesHtml:
퇴화된 locule들은 epithelial lining이 없어지고 fibrosis가 진행되면서 contracture가 나타나는 것을 확인할 수 있습니다.

Epithelial lining was denuded and replaced by secondary fibrosis

slide.title: Atrophic mucosa
slide.notes: Microscopic examination showed variable degree of histopathologic ablation in the cyst epithelial lining of mucinous cystadenoma. The regrowth of cyst may result from remnant mucinous epithelium in the missed locule. We think that the presence of septa may influence the ablative effect by limiting the delivery of ablative agent. Thus, each needle pass must be introduced at an optimal angle, to ensure that the maximum number of locule within a cyst is punctured during a single pass. 고배율 소견상에서는 atrophic mucosa와 transitional zone 그리고 점액을 다수 포함하는 mucinous adenmoa 등이 혼재하였습니다. 치료후 초기에는 대부분의 locule이 퇴화하면서 전체 크기가 감소하였지만 시간이 지나면서 남이 있는 mucinous epithelium 이 자라나면서 다시 종양의 크기가 커진 것으로 추정되었습니다.
slide.notesNormalized: microscopic examination showed variable degree of histopathologic ablation in the cyst epithelial lining of mucinous cystadenoma. the regrowth of cyst may result from remnant mucinous epithelium in the missed locule. we think that the presence of septa may influence the ablative effect by limiting the delivery of ablative agent. thus, each needle pass must be introduced at an optimal angle, to ensure that the maximum number of locule within a cyst is punctured during a single pass. 고배율 소견상에서는 atrophic mucosa와 transitional zone 그리고 점액을 다수 포함하는 mucinous adenmoa 등이 혼재하였습니다. 치료후 초기에는 대부분의 locule이 퇴화하면서 전체 크기가 감소하였지만 시간이 지나면서 남이 있는 mucinous epithelium 이 자라나면서 다시 종양의 크기가 커진 것으로 추정되었습니다.
slide.notesHtml:
Microscopic examination showed variable degree of histopathologic ablation in the cyst epithelial lining of mucinous cystadenoma. The regrowth of cyst may result from remnant mucinous epithelium in the missed locule.

We think that the presence of septa may influence the ablative effect by limiting the delivery of ablative agent. Thus, each needle pass must be introduced at an optimal angle, to ensure that the maximum number of locule within a cyst is punctured during a single pass.

고배율 소견상에서는 atrophic mucosa와 transitional zone 그리고 점액을 다수 포함하는 mucinous adenmoa 등이 혼재하였습니다.

치료후 초기에는 대부분의 locule이 퇴화하면서 전체 크기가 감소하였지만 시간이 지나면서 남이 있는 mucinous epithelium 이 자라나면서

다시 종양의 크기가 커진 것으로 추정되었습니다.
slide.text: Atrophic mucosa Transitional area Mucinous adenoma

slide.title: Pancreas 2016
slide.notes: This is another recent data from Korea. There were 91 study patients with meidian fu of 40 months The complete ablation rate was 45%. Pancreatitis rate was 3%
slide.notesNormalized: this is another recent data from korea. there were 91 study patients with meidian fu of 40 months the complete ablation rate was 45%. pancreatitis rate was 3%
slide.notesHtml:
This is another recent data from Korea.

There were 91 study patients with meidian fu of 40 months

The complete ablation rate was 45%. Pancreatitis rate was 3%
slide.text:
Inclusion; clinically indeterminate cysts, 2 to 5cm Ethanol lavage 91 (median FU; 40 months) 33 SCA, 12 MCN, 9 IPMN, 28 uncategorized Complete resolution in 41 patients (45%)
Pancreas 2016

slide.title: Gastrointest Endosc 2016
slide.notes: Recent study from Mayo clinic published their data in GIE. The complete ablation rate was only 9%. It is lower than that of previous reports There may be several possible explanations for these different findings As mentioned by pf Ryu in previous lecture, the inclusion criteria was different (they included suspected MCN or IPMN more than 1cm In addition, they injected contrast medium into cysts before ethanol lavage, this might have limited the effectiveness of ethanol ablation. Further refinement of technique, optimal treatment indication, standardized technique will be necessary to maximize the efficacy
slide.notesNormalized: recent study from mayo clinic published their data in gie. the complete ablation rate was only 9%. it is lower than that of previous reports there may be several possible explanations for these different findings as mentioned by pf ryu in previous lecture, the inclusion criteria was different (they included suspected mcn or ipmn more than 1cm in addition, they injected contrast medium into cysts before ethanol lavage, this might have limited the effectiveness of ethanol ablation. further refinement of technique, optimal treatment indication, standardized technique will be necessary to maximize the efficacy
slide.notesHtml:
Recent study from Mayo clinic published their data in GIE.

The complete ablation rate was only 9%. It is lower than that of previous reports

There may be several possible explanations for these different findings

As mentioned by pf Ryu in previous lecture, the inclusion criteria was different (they included suspected MCN or IPMN more than 1cm

In addition, they injected contrast medium into cysts before ethanol lavage, this might have limited the effectiveness of ethanol ablation.

Further refinement of technique, optimal treatment indication, standardized technique will be necessary to maximize the efficacy
slide.text:
Inclusion; suspected MCN or BD-IPMN ≥1cm 23 patients (15 presumed BD-IPMN, 4 presumed MCN, and 4 with presumed non-mucinous cysts) Complete resolution in 2 patients (9%)
Gastrointest Endosc 2016

slide.title: Surgery is still very important
slide.notes:
During this talk, I just focused on EUS-guided treatment. However, surgery is till very important treatment modality. Because we excluded overt carcinoma and IPMN, there are still existing non-responders.
One limitation of EUS guided therapy is the difficulty of operation after failure. This treatment causes fibrosis with adhesion and subsequent surgery becomes a little more difficult.

during this talk, i just focused on eus-guided treatment. however, surgery is till very important treatment modality. because we excluded overt carcinoma and ipmn, there are still existing non-responders.
one limitation of eus guided therapy is the difficulty of operation after failure. this treatment causes fibrosis with adhesion and subsequent surgery becomes a little more difficult.
slide.notesHtml:
During this talk, I just focused on EUS-guided treatment.

However, surgery is till very important treatment modality.

Because we excluded overt carcinoma and IPMN, there are still existing non-responders.

One limitation of EUS guided therapy is the difficulty of operation after failure.

This treatment causes fibrosis with adhesion and subsequent surgery becomes a little more difficult.
slide.text:
excluded overt carcinoma, IPMN still existing non-responder difficulty of operation after failure causing fibrosis & adhesion
Surgery is still very important !

slide.title: SUMMARY
slide.notes: After showing complete ablation, durable response
slide.notesNormalized: after showing complete ablation, durable response
slide.notesHtml: After showing complete ablation, durable response
slide.text: SUMMARY EUS-guided ethanol ablation Safe and durable response (low recurrence) Alternative to surveillance policy A minimally invasive bridge therapy to final surgical resection in MCN Unilocular and smaller cyst (<35mm); predictive of complete ablation

slide.title: CONCLUSIONS
slide.notes: In conclusion, EUS guided therapy can be an effective option for the treatment of cystic tumors of the pancreas. However, careful patient selection and tailored intervention are required To avoid unnecessary trial and to maximize the therapeutic efficacy. IPMN is Thank you very much for your kind attention.
slide.notesNormalized: in conclusion, eus guided therapy can be an effective option for the treatment of cystic tumors of the pancreas. however, careful patient selection and tailored intervention are required to avoid unnecessary trial and to maximize the therapeutic efficacy. ipmn is thank you very much for your kind attention.
slide.notesHtml:
In conclusion, EUS guided therapy can be an effective option for the treatment of cystic tumors of the pancreas.

However, careful patient selection and tailored intervention are required

To avoid unnecessary trial and to maximize the therapeutic efficacy.

IPMN is

Thank you very much for your kind attention.
slide.text:
CONCLUSIONS EUS-PCA can be a definitive therapy for pancreatic cystic tumors in selected cases.
However, careful patient selection & tailored intervention are required - to avoid unnecessary trial and - to maximize the therapeutic efficacy.
